subject: @After method is called even if @Before fails on exception
msgSnippet: I have a similar code to this: @Before public void someFailingMethod() { throw new RuntimeException( before ); } @After public void shouldNotBeCalled() { throw
messageBody:
I have a similar code to this:

@Before public void someFailingMethod()
{
throw new RuntimeException("before");
}

@After public void shouldNotBeCalled()
{
throw new RuntimeException("after");
}

The outcome is:

java.lang.RuntimeException: after
at com.t.Test.shouldNotBeCalled(Test.java:45)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown...

I would expect that if setup fails (i.e., @Before) than teardown
should not be called. Since teardown expects the initial setup to do
its job.
